title.narrative: BEHAVIOR AND SOCIAL CHANGE

description.narrative: Strategies to address cross-cutting sociocultural issues relating to children's rights are implemented., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is efficiently coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards for achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strategies to address cross-cutting sociocultural issues relating to children?s rights are implemented.

description.narrative: Through implementation of RCCE plans and strategies, 22,000,000 people were reached with messages on COVID-19 prevention, access to care and treatment with an emphasis on immunization.; Additionally, 4 million persons were reached with KRC-related lifesaving messages in 4 priority regions, mostly through community platforms. 65 new Community Engagement and Participation Platforms were set-up in emergency and development settings to support RCCE/SBCC strategies on COVID-19 and KRC. To meet C4D five quality benchmarks (Community Engagement, Capacity Building, Evidence generation and Use, Budgeting, and Coordination), technical support was provided at both upstream and operational level for social norms and behavior change. | Status:Met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
